bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Eduardo Angles, August 14, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests information about the Yellow Fever Commission, and for the current names of residents in houses where Walter Reed noted outbreaks of yellow fever in 1900, to verify that the addresses have not changed.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Eduardo Angles, August 14, 1940
div1.opener:
Forgot to send him his snapshot
Yellow Fever
August 14, 1940
Dr. Eduardo Angles
19 General Lee Street
Marianao, Havana
Cuba
My dear Doctor Angles:
div1.p:
I had the pleasure of meeting you with Mr. Moran in April when
I was doing some medical historical researches on Walter Reed and his yellow
fever work. I have been asked to make a report to the Cuban government explain-
ing why I think they have erroneously located the site of Camp Lazear by the
railroad track behind Military City. I will appreciate very much your telling
me what you know of this. I understand that you were connected in some way
with the yellow fever work at that time. I should like to know just what
your relationship was. I recollect your telling me that although you believed
that Camp Lazear had been properly located by the government, you had known
of a “provisional camp” established by Reed on the farm of Dr. Rojas in
Quemados.

I would appreciate greatly if you would write me what you know
about this.

Also may I ask your help in another matter? In 1900, Walter Reed
first began to suspect that yellow fever was due to a winged agent when he
noticed that yellow fever jumped from #102 Real Street around the corner to
#20 General Lee Street, and then to another house right across from the latter
house. Mr. Moran and I found houses #102 Real Street and #20 General Lee Street.
I wondered whether these were the same houses or whether the numbers had been
changed sometime since 1900, but Senor Angel Suarez-Solis, who lives in #102 Real
Street, insisted that that house number had not been changed. Could you tell me
who now lives in #20 General Lee Street? I should like to write him. Do you
think this number may have been changed? Also do you know who lives right across
from #20 General Lee Street? I gather that this must be very close to your own
home, and assuming that you know the names of these residents, I am taking the
liberty of asking you this great favor.
div1.closer: Most sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
